abstract: Michael Malone recounts family vacations in area of New York State's Catskills known as Irish Alps due to large number of Irish-themed inns; from 1950s to mid-1960s, area was summer destination for New York City's Irish immigrants seeking clean air and relief from hot, airless tenements; area has declined economically and in popularity and now offers such resorts, but officials express optimism about its future.

headline.print_headline: The Last, Sweet Days of the Irish Alps
headline.main: The Last, Sweet Days of the Irish Alps in Upstate New York

snippet: A man and his family return to their old stamping ground, now past its heyday, and the memories of swimming and dancing and summer fun come rushing back....
lead_paragraph: A man and his family return to their old stamping ground, now past its heyday, and the memories of swimming and dancing and summer fun come rushing back.
